Many of our Chromebooks need to be updated, so we are asking those 7th-12th grade students, and any online students to follow these steps to update their computers.

Here are the directions to follow for updating:
1. Click on the time and battery icon in the lower right hand corner of your screen.
2. In the menu that pops up, click the gear icon at the top of the menu second button from the right.
3. In the window that pops up, click on "About Chrome OS" at the bottom of the left hand menu.
4. Click the button that says "Check for updates"

It will probably have a button after updating to click to restart. Click it. Repeat the process until it tells you your Chromebook is up to date.

Thank you for your help with this. It will make things run much smoother. Please let us know if we can assist you.

Good afternoon Pekin Community,

We want to congratulate student, Faith Goudy, on the scholarship below that she recently was awarded.

On behalf of the Ottumwa Regional Legacy Foundation and the Laboratory Control Ltd. Scholarship Committee, let me be the first to say Congratulations Faith! You have been selected as a recipient of the LCL Health Care Career Scholarship in the amount of $1,000.00 for the 2020-2021 school year.

This scholarship award was made possible by a permanently endowed fund to support exceptional students in their educational journey towards a degree in health care. The scholarship committee also hopes to encourage these students, upon completion of their degree, to return to the SE Iowa area to live and work. As such, the scholarship committee is also here to assist you in obtaining exploratory, job shadow, or internship opportunities with area health care professionals and organizations.

Congratulations Faith, we are extremely proud of you.

Good evening,

This is principal, Kim Ledger, with information regarding the end of the school year.

The buildings will be open from 7AM-7PM on Fri., May 22nd so students can return completed work, library and text books, and computers with bags and chargers. You may also pick up any personal items at this time. Please check all students desks, lockers, PE lockers, etc. and gather all your items as we prepare for summer shut down and cleaning. Teachers have been gathering and organizing items so this should be a quick visit. Preschool students may pick up their supplies at the elementary.

We want to thank all students, parents, and community members who have helped us through this difficult time. We truly wish you all a very happy summer, and look forward to returning to school in the fall as scheduled. Please watch our Facebook page and district website for potential changes and updated information.

See you all on May 22nd, the last day of school for 2019-2020!

Good morning Pekin Community,

Pekin High School, along with other schools from across the nation will be participating in the #BeTheLight Campaign. To show our support for the senior class of 2020, our spring sports athletes and activities participants, coaches, families, health care workers and members of our community that are helping each other out during this time. We will light up Tom Stone field each evening this week starting at 8:00 PM for 52 minutes (this is the number of seniors students we have). The lights are a beacon to show that we are thinking of our students and that eventually, we will come back together and participate again.

We ask that you please do not come to the school and gather during this time so that we can adhere to the social distancing requirements. We will broadcast this event on our Pekin Schools Facebook page. During the broadcast we will be playing favorite songs from our 2020 senior class.

Go Panthers!

Bob Tollefson

Greetings Pekin Families,

Those that ordered Pekin track apparel, it has arrived. Our plan for delivery will be to send it out to the food delivery locations this Wednesday, April 8 from 5-6 pm.
Please email Ann Swanson at ann.swanson@pekincsd.org for which site you prefer.

The options are:
Packwood, Friendship Park
Richland, City Square
Ollie, City Park
Hedrick, Civic Center/Gym
If these times and locations do not work for you, please email Bob Tollefson at bob.tollefson@pekincsd.org and we will come up with another plan.

Thank you,
Bob Tollefson
7-12 Principal

If interested in meal delivery during this time of school closure, please fill out the form located at the link below.
-You must be signed up by 5 pm on Sunday, April 5, to be included in next weeks delivery.
-Meals are delivered on Mondays and Wednesdays from 5-6 pm at designated locations.
-You only need to sign up one time. Once your children are on the list, you will continue to receive meals during school closure, at no charge.
-This program is open to ALL students, 18 and younger, no matter on your financial situation.

If you have any questions, please contact Ann Swanson at 319-695-3039 x-203 or email ann.swanson@pekincsd.org

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd3nFvB9nC_nVLaKio94katk-bL2ckS0JgxfCJzkrU8ecVsVA/viewform?usp=sf_link
